## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 728, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 136, 554, 154]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 168, 241, 186]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 197, 368, 215]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0\),  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 216, 576, 252]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 266, 230, 283]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[250, 285, 737, 326]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 330, 477, 371]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 393, 384, 410]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 413, 522, 442]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\{2a + (n - 1)d\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 466, 267, 484]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = a r^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 487, 416, 556]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 574, 586, 592]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 606, 161, 622]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[423, 621, 574, 670]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 700, 243, 717]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 717, 581, 751]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 758, 584, 778]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 785, 551, 814]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[341, 73, 544, 92]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = 3 + \mathrm{e}^{x}\quad \mathrm{for} x\in \mathbb{R}\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[341, 104, 544, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}(x) = 9x - 5\quad \mathrm{for} x\in \mathbb{R}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 135, 146, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 376, 154]]<|/det|>
Find the range of f and of g.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 275, 144, 294]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 275, 489, 294]]<|/det|>
Find the exact solution of \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x) = \mathrm{g}'(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 276, 920, 295]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 585, 143, 603]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 585, 428, 603]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of \(\mathrm{g}^{2}(x) = 112\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 585, 920, 603]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 581, 92]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\log_2 x + 2\log_4 y = 8\), find the value of \(xy\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 459, 146, 478]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 459, 767, 479]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(y = 2^{x}\), or otherwise, solve \(2^{2x + 1} - 2^{x + 1} - 2^{x} + 1 = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 459, 920, 478]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 96, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 114]]<|/det|>
At time \(t\) s, a particle travelling in a straight line has acceleration \((2t + 1)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\mathrm{ms}^{-2}\) . When \(t = 0\) , the particle is \(4\mathrm{m}\) from a fixed point \(O\) and is travelling with velocity \(8\mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) away from \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 125, 144, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 123, 485, 144]]<|/det|>
Find the velocity of the particle at time \(t\) s.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 495, 146, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 495, 586, 515]]<|/det|>
Find the displacement of the particle from \(O\) at time \(t\) s.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 496, 920, 515]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 144, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 767, 96]]<|/det|>
Write \(2x^{2} + 3x - 4\) in the form \(a(x + b)^{2} + c\) , where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 215, 144, 234]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 214, 850, 237]]<|/det|>
Hence write down the coordinates of the stationary point on the curve \(y = 2x^{2} + 3x - 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 215, 920, 234]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 342, 144, 361]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 339, 920, 376]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = \left|2x^{2} + 3x - 4\right|\), showing the exact values of the intercepts of the curve with the coordinate axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 356, 920, 375]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 907, 707]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 823, 146, 841]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 821, 747, 845]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\) for which \(\left|2x^{2} + 3x - 4\right| = k\) has exactly 3 values of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 823, 920, 842]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[303, 73, 732, 94]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = 6x^{3} + ax^{2} + 12x + b, \text{ where } a \text{ and } b \text{ are integers.}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 106, 880, 126]]<|/det|>
p(x) has a remainder of 11 when divided by \(x - 3\) and a remainder of \(-21\) when divided by \(x + 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 138, 146, 156]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 136, 918, 156]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = (x - 2)Q(x)\), find \(Q(x)\), a quadratic factor with numerical coefficients. [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[88, 739, 116, 757]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 737, 344, 755]]<|/det|>
Hence solve \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 737, 920, 755]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 83, 99, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 144, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 76, 514, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the unit vector in the direction of \(\left(- \frac{5}{12}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 203, 144, 223]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 808, 234]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\binom{4}{1} + k\binom{- 2}{3} = r\binom{- 10}{5}\), find the value of each of the constants \(k\) and \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 207, 920, 227]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 917, 108]]<|/det|>
Relative to an origin \(O\), the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors \(\mathbf{p}\), \(3\mathbf{q} - \mathbf{p}\) and \(9\mathbf{q} - 5\mathbf{p}\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 116, 181, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 116, 425, 135]]<|/det|>
Find \(\overrightarrow{AB}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{p}\) and \(\mathbf{q}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 137]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 210, 181, 229]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 210, 425, 229]]<|/det|>
Find \(\overrightarrow{AC}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{p}\) and \(\mathbf{q}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 212, 920, 231]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 304, 180, 323]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 304, 569, 323]]<|/det|>
Explain why \(A, B\) and \(C\) all lie in a straight line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 306, 920, 324]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 526, 180, 545]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 526, 386, 545]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 526, 920, 545]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 82, 648, 297]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 314, 920, 365]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows an isosceles triangle \(OAB\) such that \(OA = OB = 12 \text{cm}\) and angle \(AOB = \theta\) radians. Points \(C\) and \(D\) lie on \(OA\) and \(OB\) respectively such that \(CD\) is an arc of the circle, centre \(O\), radius \(10 \text{cm}\). The area of the sector \(OCD = 35 \text{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 377, 144, 395]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 377, 307, 395]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\theta = 0.7\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 377, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 439, 146, 458]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 439, 470, 458]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 439, 920, 458]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 672, 144, 691]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 672, 428, 691]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 672, 920, 691]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression has a first term of 7 and a common difference of 0.4. Find the least number of terms so that the sum of the progression is greater than 300.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 495, 146, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 494, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
The sum of the first two terms of a geometric progression is 9 and its sum to infinity is 36. Given that the terms of the progression are positive, find the common ratio.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 87, 875, 400]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 414, 920, 483]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(xy = 2\) intersecting the straight line \(y = 5x - 3\) at the point \(A\). The straight line meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(B\). The point \(C\) lies on the \(x\)-axis and the point \(D\) lies on the curve such that the line \(CD\) has equation \(x = 3\). Find the exact area of the shaded region, giving your answer in the form \(p + \ln q\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants. [8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 104, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 146, 101]]<|/det|>
(a)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 77, 890, 104]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = x\sqrt{x + 2}\), show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{Ax + B}{2\sqrt{x + 2}}\), where \(A\) and \(B\) are constants.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 918, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 755, 94]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the stationary point of the curve \(y = x\sqrt{x + 2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 415, 143, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 415, 507, 434]]<|/det|>
Determine the nature of this stationary point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 433]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
